basics.name: Brantley Gilbert
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Full-stack software engineer with team leadership experience at both startups and Fortune 500 companies. Highly experienced with ASP.NET and Microsoft Azure but adaptable to any stack. Passionate about continuous learning, mentoring, and building products that surprise and delight with diverse teams.

work.name: SVT Robotics, Inc
work.summary: Technical lead for Data Ingestion and Insights project. Advocate for adoption of latest CI/CD and DevOps practices.
highlights: Architected warehouse-to-cloud enterprise messaging system with Azure Service Bus and Functions to allow for exporting large amounts of order fulfillment and automated material handling data from on-site warehouse management systems to cloud data analysis systems, enabling customer cross-site insights.
Lead the design and rollout of customer data streaming using Azure Event Hubs and webhooks to allow customer analyts to receive warehouse operation data in real-time.
Implemented migration of Docker-based on-prem customer site installations to automated cloud-hosted Azure App Service deployments using Azure Bicep infrastructure-as-code templates.

Migrated identity services from Azure AD B2C to highly customizable Duende IdentityServer OAuth/OpenID implementation to enable multi-factor authentication, SSO, and email customization with SendGrid.
Coordinated with QA and security engineers to achieve SOC 2 certification of cloud-based systems through data encryption, network controls, and automated testing.
Created an automated PostgreSQL database monitoring and cleanup process with React front-end to assist site services engineers with troubleshooting and maintaining on-prem data stores.

work.name: CarMax, Inc.
work.summary: Senior software engineer with a focus on RESTful API development.
highlights: Utilized internal Enterprise Service Bus and customer Master Data Management system to corrlate online and in-store customer activities in order to create a wholistic view of customer activities as part of Customer Progression team. Enabled online customer account management through MyCarMax portal.
Created a React microsite with .NET Core API to implement online car-buying flow on carmax.com as part of the Checkout team. Implemented WorldPay integration to enable online down payments.
Won the 2019 CarMax Innovation Garage hackathon with a Chrome browser extension to scrape vehicle listings on competitor sites and allow for side-by-side comparisons.

work.name: Data Works, Inc. (Acquired by QinetiQ)
highlights: Used Apache Spark for processing large amounts of PDF documents and Apache Tika for Natural Language Processing and sentiment analysis.
For final project implemented a resume parsing process using reinforcement learning to rank potential candidates based on employer hiring history.

publications.name: United States Patent
publications.publisher: United States Patent and Trademark Office
publications.summary: Systems and methods for dynamically ingesting and monitoring online products

references.name: Everett Comstock
references.reference: Brantley is one of the finest young developers that I've ever worked with. On a daily basis, he shows more knowledge and skill than many who have been in the profession for decades. He is always open to new ideas and engages in thoughtful discussions. Most impressively he always conducts himself with humility and respect. He is on his way to becoming a strong technical leader, and I hope that the next time our paths cross he'll consider adding me to his team!
